they use here in this middle paragraph so graph QL is a query language for your API and a server-side runtime for
executing queries using a type system you define for your data graph QL is not tied to any specific database or storage
engine and instead backed by your existing code in data so again just to unpack that a little bit a common
misconception I hear a lot from people as they think graph QL is something to do with graph databases it doesn't you
can use graph databases with graph QL but there's no requirement to do so graph QL is basically just a
specification that says here is how clients should ask for data from an API
from a server and it's strongly specification that's defined using a
schema definition language that basically says here are the data types that can be exchanged and here are the
queries that the client is allowed to ask for and here are the mutations that the client is allowed to affect against that API that's it it's up to you to
implement the graph QL service and whatever you know programming language and data storage technologies you want
